Uses of Class
Racer

    • Uses of Racer in <Unnamed>

      Subclasses of Racer in <Unnamed> 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Dog
      Dog Represents the Dog Enemy Dog has fairly simple behaviour, and is a real top gal.
      class  Elephant
      Elephant Represents the Elephant Enemy Elephant is the most basic Enemy and can be considered a template upon which additional behaviours could be added.
      class  Enemy
      Enemy Abstract class from which specific Enemy subclasses can be created and instantiated This abstract class defines standard methods that will be inherited by the different subtypes of Enemy, namely Octopus, Dog and Elephant.
      class  Octopus
      Octopus Represents the Octopus Enemy Octopus is, as said in the spec, a bit of a jerk, and if within a certain range of the Player will target them instead of the waypoints, attempting to collide with them.
      class  Player
      Player Represents the player of the game Handles things specific to the player.
      Methods in <Unnamed> with parameters of type Racer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean Item.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      Specifying that each Item derived from this class must have a useEffect method which can be called when the Item is collided with.
      boolean Tomato.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the item.
      boolean Boost.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the Item to the Racer, namely Player.
      boolean Oil.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the item.
      void Item.applyOilTomatoEffect(Racer racer)
      This effect is held here in Item because it is common to both Oil and Tomato.
      void Racer.update(double rotateDir, double moveDir, World world, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, Racer[] racers)
      Updates the angle and speed of the car, as well as processing any
      static void Enemy.updateEnemies(World world, Racer[] racers, Enemy[] enemies, Player player, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, double[][] waypoints)
      This method is a gateway to the methods that do most of the heavy lifting with the implementation of all the Enemies.
